big, large, major, great, wide, deep, eldest

to be possible to, to be able to, to be okay to (typically after the verb); used to express limitation or restriction, to only have; used to join a verb to its degree or results; to have gone so far as to, to have even; to receive, to get; to calculate, to compute; advantage

a little bit; some, few; -ly as in quickly (specifically used in imperative); -er as in faster, but not used for direct comparison

how are things?, how's it going?

how much, how many; several; a few
to call, to be called; to shout, to call out

to go; indicates movement away from the speaker

to have; there is, to exist
right now, currently, at the present, at the moment

to come, to arrive; indicates movement toward the speaker

dollar, money; this particular character also means mosquito
have not, to not have; to not exist, there is no
